name: Mixed Bag 4 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [B] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Chicago's St. Valentine's Day massacre occurred in what year?
questions.explanation:
1929.

	Six of Bugs Moran's gangsters and a visitor were killed.

questions.text: Who was the Lebanese American comic who played the postman on radio's 'The Fanny Brice Show'?
questions.explanation:
Danny Thomas.

	Fanny Brice originated the comic child character Baby Snooks.

questions.text: Name the location of the America's Cup race against the Australians in 1983.
questions.explanation:
Newport.

	From 1930 to 1983 the America's Cup races were held in Newport.

questions.text: (True or False) Sarah Bernhardt had a wooden leg?
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	She was a French actress who was born in 1844 and died in 1923. Her leg was amputated at the age of 70 after which she continued to perform.

questions.text: Filmland's Harvey was an invisible what?
questions.explanation:
Rabbit.

	The 1950 movie starred Jimmy Stewart.

questions.text: What is a hare's home called?
questions.explanation:
Form.

	Hare's are born furred with open eyes while rabbits are born naked with closed eyes.

questions.text: Nelson Eddy and Jeanette MacDonald made how many musical films together?
Name the nearest continent to Antarctica.
questions.explanation:
South America.

	It is the fifth largest continent and is about 600 miles from South America.

questions.text: Who played the best selling theme song on TV's 'Peter Gunn'?
questions.explanation:
Henry Mancini.

	Mancini lived from 1924 to 1994. He also wrote the 'Pink Panther' film theme song.

questions.text: Which female personality was the host of the radio show 'Blind Date' in 1943?
questions.explanation:
Arlene Francis.

	Known at one time as radio's 'oomph girl'. She was also a regular on TV's 'What's My Line'. She died at the age of 93 of cancer.
